page.title: 12THE HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: {Wymondham Health Centre}is a large new building opposite our school. It was built by a Norwich firm and opened on 7th February,1983. The building is occupied by about 40 local staff, including 7 General Practioners, a school Doctor, Health Visitors, 2 Midwives, District Nurses, 2 chiropodists, an orthopist, an audiologist, a speech therapist, and several receptionists. It is kept clean by a Caretaker and 3 cleaners. When we visited the Centre the Friday morning baby clinic was almost over. We were interested in how the babies were handled.On arrival each baby's name,date of birth and weight was recorded. As well as seeing 60 or 70 babies per week,doctors share the four surgery times each day, seeing an average of 48 patients. Staff also deal with emergencies at week-ends.
